article.name: KnowBe4 Community Guide
article.title: KnowBe4 Community Guide
article.body:
What Is the KnowBe4 Community?

The KnowBe4 Community is a private online user community designed for all admins, Partners, Security Role users, and employees (Knowsters) to connect, share knowledge, and collaborate on new ideas. Community members can access exclusive news from our team, share feedback about our products, participate in user surveys, and more.

If you have any questions, concerns, or suggestions about the community, reach out to community@knowbe4.com. For any product-related technical issues, contact our support team or your Account Manager.

Getting Started

To get started with the community, you'll need to register your account and set up your profile. For more information, see the subsections below.

Registering Your Account

If this is your first time accessing the community, follow the steps below to register your account:

  1. Log in to your KSAT console.
  2. Click your email address in the top-right corner of the page, then click KnowBe4 Community. You’ll be taken to the Set username page.
  3. Create your username. Your username is how other community members will identify you. Once your username is set, you won't be able to change it.
    Note: Your community email address will be the email address from your KSAT console. If you change your email address in your console, your community account will remain the same.
  4. Select the check box to accept the Terms of Use.
  5. Click Save. You’ll be redirected to the community home page.
Important: If an admin’s account is deleted in the KSAT console, their KnowBe4 Community account will be deleted as well.

Accessing the Community

After you register your account, you can access the community through your KSAT console or PhishER platform.

To access the community from your KSAT console, click your email address in the top-right corner of the page. Then, click KnowBe4 Community.

To access the community from your PhishER platform, click the user icon at the bottom of the navigation bar. Then, click KnowBe4 Community.

Important:You'll need to be logged into the KnowBe4 Community first to open links in community email notifications.

Setting Up Your Profile

We recommend setting up your profile to customize your settings and preferences.

To set up your profile, follow the steps below:

  1. Go to the KnowBe4 Community.
  2. Click your profile picture in the top-right corner of the page, then click Profile.

  3. Under your username, click Edit Settings. You’ll be taken to the Settings page.

  4. On the Profile subtab, you can edit your profile picture, personal details, and more.
  5. When you’re finished editing information on this subtab, click Save Changes.
  6. On the General subtab, you can edit your notification settings, enable the option to display your badges, and more.
  7. When you’re finished setting up your profile, click Save Changes.

Navigating the Community

You can navigate through the spaces in the community to connect with other members, share knowledge, and collaborate on new ideas. To learn about the spaces in the community, see the subsections below:

Explore

In the Explore space, you can join conversations, ask for help, and share experiences with the community. This space is divided into the pages listed below:

  • Welcome: On this page, you can learn how to use the community and introduce yourself to other community members.
  • Learn and Share: On this page, you can share success stories, discuss best practices, and chat about security news.
  • Ask the Community: On this page, you can ask the community for help, tips, and advice on all things KnowBe4 and cybersecurity.

Ideas

In the Ideas space, you can submit ideas for our products, see updates on proposed product ideas, and vote on ideas that you like. Our team can view proposed ideas and submit a working status on your ideas. For more information on how to submit an idea and our review process, see our Ideas Guide on the community.

Note: Ideas were previously known as feature requests. We have reworked the process to improve communication between community members and our team.

News

In the News space, you can stay up to date with the latest news. You can also interact with our team about new updates in our products.

Groups

In the Groups space, you can join different groups based on betas, industries, regions, and more. Once you join a group, you can create posts to ask questions or start conversations with other group members.

Product Demos

Community members get exclusive access to our full product walkthroughs in the community. These walkthroughs are available for all products and are available in multiple languages. If you don't see the language you need, please submit a support ticket.

Notification Center

Click the bell icon to view the Notification Center.

The Notification Center is a dedicated space to view real-time updates from the last 30 days. This space ensures that you stay informed about replies, mentions, ideas, product news, groups, and all other subscribed community assets without relying solely on email notifications. In the notification center, you can mark notifications as read or unread either individually or all at once.

Working with Posts

Note: All members of the KnowBe4 Community must follow our Terms of Use.

In the community, you can create posts and reply to posts from other members. To learn how to create, edit, report, and interact with posts, see the subsections below.

Creating a Post

You can create a post to ask a question, start a conversation, or submit an idea. To create a new post, click Create Post in the top-right corner of the page. Then, fill out the fields with information about your post. For more information, see the screenshot and list below:

Important: To keep your information safe, avoid sharing private information about yourself or your organization.
  1. What kind of post are you creating?: Select the category for your post. For more information, see the list below:
    • Question: Select this category to ask a question about one of our products.
    • Conversation: Select this category to share an experience and start a conversation with other community members.
    • Idea: Select this category to share an idea or suggestion to improve our products
  2. Title: Enter a short, descriptive title for your post. If possible, include the name of the product or service.
  3. Details: Enter a detailed description for your post. You can upload images and videos to your post to better describe your question, experience, or idea.
  4. Category: Select a category for your post. For example, a post about a security tip you’ve discovered should go in the Show and Tell category.
  5. Tags (Optional): Select or enter a tag for your post. Tags are keywords that describe your post so other users can find it. For example, a post about leaderboards could have a gamification tag.

Once you're ready to publish your post, click Create.

Editing a Post

If you made a mistake while creating your post or you would like to add more information to it, you can edit the post.

Note: You can edit your post for up to one hour after you've created it. If your post contains private information that you’re unable to edit and would like to have removed, send the post to community@knowbe4.com.

To edit a post, follow the steps below:

  1. Navigate to the post you would like to edit. You can access your posts by clicking your profile picture in the top-right corner of the screen and then selecting Posts.
  2. Scroll down to the bottom of the post.
  3. At the bottom-right corner of the page, hover your mouse over the three dots icon, then click Edit.

  4. Edit the fields you would like to change.
  5. Click Save to publish your changes.

Reporting a Post or Comment

If you notice an inappropriate post or comment that conflicts with our Terms of Use, please report it. Please report any of the inappropriate content listed below:

  • Spam
  • Advertising
  • Soliciting
  • Harassment
  • Private information, such as email addresses or phone numbers
  • Any other content that conflicts with the guidelines above

To report a post or comment, follow the steps below:

  1. Navigate to the post or comment.
  2. Click the three dots icon at the bottom-right corner of the post or comment.
  3. Click Flag.

If you're unsure whether you should report a post or a comment, please report it anyway. A Community Manager will review your report as soon as possible.

Interacting with Posts

There are several ways you can interact with posts, such as replying or subscribing to them. For more information, see the screenshot and list below:

  1. Like: Click this button to like the post. Community members will be able to see who likes the post.
  2. Quote: Click this button to quote the post in a reply. You can use this feature to reply to a specific part of a post instead of replying to the entire post.
  3. Subscribe: Click this button to receive email notifications about updates to the post.
  4. Three dots: Hover your mouse over this icon to view additional options, such as reporting the post or copying a link to it.
  5. Was this post helpful?: This option will only display on resolved Question posts. Select an emoji to rate the post based on helpfulness.
  6. Reply: In this field, enter a reply to the post. Then, click Send.

You can use the Translate drop-down menu to translate posts and replies into your preferred language. This setting allows you to engage with posts made in other languages.

Using Gamification

As you participate in community activities, you'll earn badges, points, and ranks.

Ranks can be earned by doing actions like creating posts, answering questions, and more. Move up the ranks to become a Super User and unlock exclusive perks in the community!

images.alt:
This image displays the community **Explore** page, structured into three primary content sections: Navigation, Header/Search, and Categories.

1.  **Navigation (Top Left):**
    *   A breadcrumb trail is present, indicating the user's location: `Home > Explore`.

2.  **Header and Search Section (Banner):**
    *   This section is contained within a light orange background panel.
    *   **H1 Title:** Centered, large-font heading: **Explore**.
    *   **Subtitle:** Centered, descriptive text: `Join discussions, ask for help, and share experiences with the community.`
    *   **Search Component:** A centralized, rectangular input field with a search icon (magnifying glass) on the left. The placeholder text reads: `Search for questions, conversations, ideas, and more...`

3.  **Categories Section:**
    *   **H2 Title:** Left-aligned heading identifying the content: `Categories`.
    *   **Category Cards:** A horizontal display of three primary category tiles (card UI elements) for navigating the community content:
        *   **Welcome**
        *   **Learn and Share**
        *   **Ask the Community**
images.context: ommunity for help, tips, and advice on all things KnowBe4 and cybersecurity.

images.alt:
This image captures the header section of a web page titled "Ideas," typically functioning as a community suggestion or collaboration portal.

**Context and Navigation:**
*   **Breadcrumb Path:** Located in the top left, the navigation path displays `Home > Ideas`. "Home" appears linked (indicated by orange text color).
*   **Design:** The background utilizes a light lavender/pink hero banner area, accented by minimalist, abstract decorative shapes (rounded corners, small dots) in the periphery.

**Main Content and Functionality:**
*   **Page Title:** A large, centered, dark-text heading reads: **Ideas**.
*   **Description:** Directly beneath the title is the instructional subtext: "Propose new ideas and see updates on submissions from other community members."
*   **Search Input Field:** Centrally located is a rectangular search box, styled with a white background and a subtle light gray border.
    *   **Placeholder Text:** The field contains a magnifying glass icon preceding the placeholder text: "Search for questions, conversations, ideas, and more..."

This image displays the header section of a web page titled **News**, indicating a community or internal communications platform.

**UI Elements and Text:**

1.  **Breadcrumb Navigation (Top Left):** Displays the hierarchy: `Home > News`.
2.  **Page Title (Center):** A large, bold heading reading **News**.
3.  **Page Description (Subtitle):** Standard text centered below the title: `Stay up to date with the latest news and engage with our team.`.
4.  **Search Input Field:** A prominent, centrally located rectangular search bar.
    *   **Icon:** Features a magnifying glass icon positioned left of the input area.
    *   **Placeholder Text:** `Search for questions, conversations, ideas, and more...`.

The background features abstract mint/cyan graphical elements (rounded shapes and small dots) positioned in the upper corners, overlaid on a transition from white to a light mint color.
images.context: You can also interact with our team about new updates in our products.

images.alt:
This is a screenshot of a web application's group discovery page, titled "Groups" (H1 header).

**UI Structure and Context:**
*   **Breadcrumb Navigation:** Located at the top left, displaying `Home > Groups`.
*   **Section Header:** A sub-heading `Discover Groups` introduces the primary content.
*   **Content Display:** Two primary group components are displayed side-by-side in a card format, both offering a `Join` action.

**Component Details (Card 1 - Left):**
*   **Group Name (Header):** `Education` (White text on a solid orange background with decorative sparkles).
*   **Group Details (Body):**
    *   Title: `Education`
    *   Status/Visibility: `Public`
*   **Action Element:** A full-width, rounded, orange call-to-action button labeled `Join`.

**Component Details (Card 2 - Right):**
*   **Group Name (Header):** `Government` (White text on a solid purple background with decorative sparkles).
*   **Group Details (Body):**
    *   Title: `Government`
    *   Status/Visibility: `Public`
*   **Action Element:** A full-width, rounded, orange call-to-action button labeled `Join`.

images.alt:
This image displays a resource management interface titled **"Product Demos"**. The screen is structured with a primary navigation filter, a secondary language filter, and a content grid presenting individual demo listings.

**UI Elements and Context:**

1.  **Title and Context:** The main header is **"Product Demos"** (H1).
2.  **Primary Filtering (Horizontal Navigation):** A set of text links allows filtering by product category. The currently active filter is **"All"** (indicated by an orange underline). Other filters listed are: "Security Awareness Training (SAT)", "AIDA", "SecurityCoach", "PhishER", "Defend", and "Prevent".
3.  **Secondary Filtering (Dropdown):** A dropdown selector labeled **"All languages (23)"** is present, indicating 23 available language options for the resources.

**Content Display (Demo Cards):**

The main content area presents resources in three vertical cards, each featuring an orange icon, a title, and an action link.

*   **Card 1 (AIDA Onboarding):**
    *   **Icon:** Orange icon featuring a stylized lightbulb.
    *   **Language Tag:** **"ENGLISH"** (orange background).
    *   **Title:** "AIDA Onboarding Webinar".
    *   **Action:** "Watch" (followed by a play icon).

*   **Card 2 (Defend Onboarding):**
    *   **Icon:** Orange icon featuring a large 'X' inside a circle.
    *   **Language Tag:** **"ENGLISH"** (orange background).
    *   **Title:** "Defend Onboarding Webinar".
    *   **Action:** "Watch" (followed by a play icon).

*   **Card 3 (KnowBe4 French Training):**
    *   **Icon:** Orange icon featuring a circular arrow/refresh symbol.
    *   **Language Tag:** **"FRENCH"** (red background).
    *   **Title:** "KnowBe4 Formation de sensibilisation à la sécurité Webinaire d'integration".
    *   **Action:** "Watch" (followed by a play icon).

images.alt:
This image captures a web interface displaying a notification dropdown panel triggered from the main navigation bar.

**UI Context (Navigation Bar):**
The top navigation includes menu items such as "Knowledge Base," "Ideas," "News," "Product Demos," and "Events." On the far right, primary user actions are visible:
1.  A **Notification Bell** icon (highlighted by an orange arrow) which is currently active, displaying the dropdown.
2.  A prominent orange action button labeled **"+ Create Post."**
3.  A circular user profile icon/avatar.

**Notifications Dropdown Panel:**
The panel is titled **"Notifications"** and contains a persistent action link **"Mark all as read"** in blue text.

**Content:**
Notifications are categorized under the header **"RECENT."** Two entries are visible:
1.  **Entry 1:** A user posted a new topic **"Technical Preview"** (highlighted in orange) in the category **"KnowBe4 Academy Technical Preview."** A timestamp indicates **"1 day ago."** A small red circle indicates this notification is unread.
2.  **Entry 2:** A user posted a new topic **"KB4 Academy Access question"** (highlighted in orange) in the category **"KnowBe4 Academy Technical Preview."** Timestamp: **"6 days ago."**

**List End:**
The notification list concludes with a system status message centered at the bottom, marked by a small flag icon: **"You've reached the end of all notifications from the past 30 days."**
images.context: otifications as read or unread either individually or all at once.

images.alt:
This image displays a User Interface (UI) form for **"Create Post"** within a web application, organized into five primary sections.

The header reads **"Create Post"** with subtext: "Ask a question, start a conversation, or share an idea."

**a. Post Type Selection:**
*   A section labeled **"What kind of post are you creating?"** includes an information icon (i).
*   It utilizes horizontal radio buttons/tabs to select the post format. **"Question"** (icon: question mark) is currently selected and highlighted with an orange border.
*   The unselected options are **"Conversation"** (icon: speech bubble) and **"Idea"** (icon: light bulb).

**b. Title Field:**
*   A mandatory input field labeled **"Title"**.
*   The placeholder text is "Enter a title for your post...".

**c. Details/Body Field:**
*   A large rich text editing area labeled **"Details"**.
*   A toolbar above the input area includes standard formatting controls: "Styles" (dropdown), Bold (B), Italics (I), Underline (U), text color (A with a rainbow underline), highlight color (A), bulleted list, numbered list, alignment controls (left, center, right, justify), emoticon, link, image, blockquote, and ellipsis (more options).
*   The main text area is currently empty.

**d. Category Selection:**
*   A dropdown menu labeled **"Category"**.
*   The placeholder text is "Select a category for your post..." and a chevron indicates dropdown functionality.

**e. Tags Field and Submission:**
*   An input field labeled **"Tags Optional"**.
*   The placeholder text is "Select one or more tags...".
*   The form concludes with a prominent, orange primary action button labeled **"Create"**.

images.alt:
This image depicts a standard user interface for a forum post or discussion thread, segmented into post actions, reply summary, and a reply input module.

**Post Interaction and Feedback Section (Top):**

A horizontal row displays common action links:
*   (a) "Like" (with a thumb-up icon).
*   (b) "Quote" (with quotation mark icon).
*   (c) "Subscribe" (with a star icon).
*   (d) An overflow menu (ellipsis icon).
Directly below these actions is a feedback prompt (e): "Was this post helpful?", accompanied by three sentiment emojis (happy, neutral, sad) for immediate rating.

**Replies Summary Section (Middle):**

This section indicates the current state of the discussion: "0 replies," followed by a call-to-action: "Be the first to reply!"

**Reply Input Module (Bottom):**

The input area is introduced by the heading "Reply," adjacent to a placeholder user avatar (f). A comprehensive WYSIWYG text editor is provided above a large text entry field.

The editor toolbar includes controls for:
*   **Styles and Formatting:** "Styles" dropdown, Bold, Italic, Underline, Text Color, Background Color.
*   **Structure:** Bulleted List, Numbered List, and text alignment controls (Left, Center, Right, Indent/Outdent).
*   **Attachments and Media:** Emoticon picker, Hyperlink, Image insertion, Attachment (paperclip), Block Quote, and an overflow menu (ellipsis).

The input module is finalized with a prominent, orange "Send" button located in the lower-left corner.

images.alt:
The image displays a sectional view of a digital content page, likely a news post or forum thread.

**Content Context (Top Section):**
*   **Tag:** An orange label marked "NEWS."
*   **Title:** "Incoming: Something Big Is Headed to Our Community!"
*   **Metadata:** "Related products: General," followed by status indicators: "14 days ago • 24 replies • 171 views."

**UI Element Focus:**
*   A user interface button labeled "**Translate**," preceded by a language icon (a stylized speech bubble and letters 'A' and 'T'), is currently selected, indicated by an open dropdown menu. A downward chevron confirms its dropdown functionality.
*   An opaque white context menu extends vertically downward from the "Translate" button.
*   This menu lists languages for translation. Visible entries include: **Chinese, Croatian, Czech, Danish,** and **Dutch** (partially visible).

**Visual Indicators:**
*   A large red arrow points directly at the active "Translate" button and the corresponding open dropdown menu.
*   The background features a partial view of a graphical banner with pink and purple elements, containing large, partially obscured text related to the title.
